item.title: about me
item.description: current assistant professor of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam past research fellow of statistics Department of Law and Economics, UnitelmaSapienza University of Rome education ph.d. in methodological statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2020) msc in statistics and decision sciences at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) bsc in statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2013) grants research grant for junior researcher “Avvio alla ricerca” (2017) award in Italian Statistical Society (SIS) competition: best report (2017) academic services session organizer and chair of the 50th edition of the Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society reviewer for Journal of Statistical Computation and Simulation reviewer for Advances in Data Analysis and Classification extra addicted to ASD Valcanneto Fustal and ice-cream

item.title: ongoing projects
item.description: my current researches are: Cavicchia, C. and Vichi, M. Second-Order Disjoint Exploratory Factor Analysis Hierarchical models are often considered to measure latent concepts defining nested set of manifest variables. Therefore, by supposing a hierarchical relationship among manifest variables, the general latent concept can be represented by a tree-structure where each internal node represents a specific level (order) of abstraction for the latent concept measured. In this paper, we propose a new latent factor model called Second-order Disjoint Exploratory Factor Analysis in order to model an unknown hierarchical structure of the manifest variables with two orders.

item.title: projects
item.description: I am a statistician and my research is focused on the methodological and computational aspects of data analysis. The best feeling is when I can use my knowledge to solve pratical and real problems. I am currently working on latent variable models, unsupervised classification and model-based composite indicators. ongoing projects events codes teaching material

(2020) Statistical Model-based Composite Indicators for tracking coherent policy conclusions. Social Indicators Research, doi conference papers Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G. (2019) Dimensionality reduction via hierarchical factorial structure.

item.title: teaching material
